title: Informal but not handwriting
content:
I need to render a tagline for a healthcare client in an informal font but don’t want it to look (a) childish; or (b) handwriting; or (c) cartoon (eg Comic Sans!)

I want it to be soft, personable, approachable, warm, serious not flippant but not too formal.

Appreciate your help!

 [‹ Recommended books for typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122041430/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47886 "Go to previous forum topic") [Text styling/house keeping. Quick question ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122041430/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47490 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Nick Job

comments.content:
Hello Nick,

[Palatino Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122041430/http:/www.linotype.com/111707/palatinosans-family.html), maybe? If that isn’t informal enough:  
there’s even Palatino Sans _Informal!_ ;-)  
F

on the Serif side, i’d like to suggest [Maple](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122041430/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/process/maple/)  
i really love it! hope that helps!

I think it is going to depend on the “logo.”

If the logo is serifed then look at some sans. If it is all caps then set the tag in Cap and lower case. If it is upright then set the tag in italics. If it is, say, condensed the go with a wider style. Etc. ad infinitum. Look for contrast... Once you have defined the parameters of what you are looking for try Veer or MyFonts-all the usual suspects.

Or you could set it in the same face, just much smaller.  
Michael
